comments:
Build id: I20051123-1200
(unlike some of my recent bug reports, I'm not doing anything funky here - just working in my development time workspace)

1) I opened the MANIFEST.MF editor for a plugin that did *not* have a plugin.xml file.
2) On the dependencies tab, I added several plugins to the list (including UI)
3) Clicked on the "Extensions" tab.

-> The page was blank.  The following error was in my log (will attach log):

java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Argument not valid
	at org.eclipse.swt.SWT.error(SWT.java:3246)
	at org.eclipse.swt.SWT.error(SWT.java:3185)
	at org.eclipse.swt.SWT.error(SWT.java:3156)
	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Control.setMenu(Control.java:2384)
	at org.eclipse.ui.forms.widgets.ScrolledForm.<init>(ScrolledForm.java:54)
	at org.eclipse.ui.forms.widgets.FormToolkit.createScrolledForm(FormToolkit.java:597)
	at org.eclipse.ui.forms.editor.FormPage.createPartControl(FormPage.java:147)
	at org.eclipse.ui.forms.editor.FormEditor.pageChange(FormEditor.java:444)
	at org.eclipse.pde.internal.ui.editor.PDEFormEditor.pageChange(PDEFormEditor.java:267)
	at org.eclipse.ui.part.MultiPageEditorPart$2.widgetSelected(MultiPageEditorPart.java:200)
Created an attachment (id=30642)
Log file

I couldn't reproduce when I tried to make the failure happen again...
I had this occur again in I20051129-1200. It was a similar situation.  I opened a manifest editor on a plugin with no plugin.xml file.  I then added an extension from the extensions tab, switched to the newly created plugin.xml tab, and pasted a wad of extension text into it. When I tried to switch away from the plugin.xml tab, the error occurred.
I'm not sure if this is the same bug or just a similar one.

I was trying out I20051213-0010 on Solaris-Motif, and tried to open org.eclipse.core.tests.harness manifest file (no plugin.xml).  I had just retrieved it from HEAD.

It wouldn't open up at all, and I got the IllegalArgumentException (attached next).

I'm going to go try this on Linux next, but Kim said she didn't have this problem on Mac.

PW
Created an attachment (id=31630)
manifest editor error

It works fine for me on Linux (on Solaris I was also getting the org.eclipse.core.tests.harness errors that usually clear up after a workspace restart).

It looks like my problem is probably not related, so I opened another bug #120573

PW
